Functions

void CAN_DeInit (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Deinitialize the specified CAN registers to their default values.
u32 CAN_SetBaudRate (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate)
 Set bus baud-rate.
void CAN_Close (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 The function is used to disable all CAN interrupt.
u32 CAN_Open (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate, u32 wMode)
 Set CAN operation mode and target baud-rate.
void CAN_CLR_INT_PENDING_BIT (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum)
 Clear interrupt pending bit.
void CAN_EnableInt (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u32Mask)
 Enable CAN interrupt. The application software has two possibilities to follow the source of a message interrupt. First, it can follow the IntId in the Interrupt Register and second it can poll the Interrupt Pending Register.
void CAN_DisableInt (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 Mask)
 Disable CAN interrupt.
s32 CAN_Transmit (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Send CAN message.
s32 CAN_Receive (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Gets the message, if received. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.
s32 CAN_SetRxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure a receive message object.
s32 CAN_SetTxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure a transmit object.
s32 CAN_TriggerTxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u32MsgNum)
 Set transmit request bit. If a transmission is requested by programming bit TxRqst/NewDat (IFn_CMASK[2]), the TxRqst (IFn_MCON[8]) will be ignored.
void CAN_EnterInitMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 This function is used to set CAN to enter initialization mode and enable access bit timing register.After bit timing configuration ready, user must call CAN_LeaveInitMode() to leave initialization mode and lock bit timing register to let new configuration take effect.
void CAN_LeaveInitMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Leave initialization mode.
void CAN_WaitMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 This function is used to Wait message into message buffer in basic mode. Please notice the function is polling NEWDAT bit of MCR register by while loop and it is used in basic mode.
u32 CAN_GetCANBitRate (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Get current bit rate.
void CAN_EnterTestMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u8TestMask)
 Switch the CAN into test mode.
void CAN_LeaveTestMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Leave the test mode.
u32 CAN_IsNewDataReceived (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj)
 Get the waiting status of a received message.
s32 CAN_BasicSendMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to Send CAN message in BASIC mode of test mode. Before call the API, the user should be call CAN_EnterTestMode(CAN_TEST_BASIC) and let CAN controller enter basic mode of test mode. Please notice IF0 Registers used as Tx Buffer in basic mode.
s32 CAN_BasicReceiveMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Get a message information in BASIC mode.
s32 CAN_SetRxMsgObj (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Set Rx message object.
s32 CAN_ReadMsgObj (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, u32 Release, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Gets the message.
s32 CAN_MsgObjMaskConfig (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *MaskMsg)
 The function is used to configure Mask as the message object.
s32 CAN_SetMultiRxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, u32 MsgCount, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure several receive message objects. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.

Detailed Description

The header file of the CAN library.
